str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.
From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and arneomai; to deny utterly, i.e. Disown, abstain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.
